Functions

00800_mcWaitNotification
[Normal_Client_API]

Involved Components and their required Functionality More...

Functions

 TestCase_GC00100_NotifyThenTimeoutInfinite ()
 TestCase_GC00101_NotifyThenTimeoutFinite ()
 TestCase_GC00102_NoNotifyThenTimeoutFinite ()
 TestCase_BC00103_NoNotifyThenThenNoTimeout ()
 TestCase_BC00104_SessionhandleNullPointer ()
 TestCase_BC00105_SessionhandleInvalidId ()
 TestCase_BC00106_SessionhandleInvalidDevice ()

Detailed Description

Involved Components and their required Functionality

  1. ClientLib
    1. Can connect to daemon
    2. Can reserve memory for connection
  2. McDriverDaemon
    1. Daemon running
    2. Daemon socket accessible by TLC
    3. mcOpenDevice()
  3. McDriverModule
    1. Module loaded
    2. Module socket accessible by daemon
    3. Module listens for connection
  4. Trusted Application TlIntegrationTest
    1. Trusted Application copied to Android on Test device as 05010000000000000000000000000000.trst
    2. Trusted Application runnable and bug-free

Generic preconditions (setup)
Generic Preconditions are the same for every test case. They are executed always in front of every single test case.

  • open device using the default ID by calling mcOpenDevice()
  • allocate a WSM buffer (4k)
  • open a session to the Trusted Application

Generic post processing (teardown)
Generic post processing is the same for every test case. It is executed always after every single test case.

  • close session to the Trusted Application
  • free allocated memory of WSM buffer
  • close Device by calling mcCloseDevice()

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00100_NotifyThenTimeoutInfinite (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Involved components running and functioning
Focus:
mcWaitNotification arbitrarily awaits for a notfication of an empty message.
Test Steps:
Trusted Application Connector notifies Trusted Application and waits infinitely for a notification of the Trusted Application (response)
Verification:
mcWaitNotification() returns MC_DRV_OK.
Response ID is set in message header on TCI.
No additional error code is set.
Test output is OK.
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Normal_Client_API.00800_mcWaitNotification.GC00100_NotifyThenTimeoutInfinite
TestCase_GC00101_NotifyThenTimeoutFinite (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Involved components running and functioning
Focus:
mcWaitNotification awaits 1 sec for a notification without an early timeout.
Test Steps:
Trusted Application Connector notifies Trusted Application and waits 1 second for a notification of the Trusted Application (response)
Verification:
mcWaitNotification() returns MC_DRV_OK.
Response ID is set in message header on TCI.
No additional error code is set.
Test output is OK.
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No

TestCase_GC00102_NoNotifyThenTimeoutFinite (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Involved components running and functioning
Focus:
mcWaitNotification handles a no notification case.
Test Steps:
Trusted Application Connector does not notify Trusted Application and waits 1 second for a notification of the Trusted Application (response)
Verification:
mcWaitNotification() returns MC_DRV_ERR_TIMEOUT.
Test output is OK.
Post Conditions:
none
